member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.Aggregations.Complete_Item_Aggregation
member.summary: Contains all of the data about a single aggregation of items, such as a collection or institutional items. This class indicates to SobekCM where to look for searches, browses, and information. It also contains all the information for rendering the home pages of each of these levels.

member.param: Language code
Web skin object which may override the banner
member.returns: Either the language-specific banner image, or else the default banner image

If NO banner images were included in the aggregation XML, then this could be the empty string.

member.summary: Gets the special front banner image for this aggregation's home page, by language
member.param: Language code
member.returns: Either the language-specific special front banner image, or else the default front banner image
member.remarks:
If NO special front banner images were included in the aggregation XML, then this could be NULL.
This is a special front banner image used for aggregationPermissions that show the highlighted item and the search box in the main banner at the top on the front page

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.EAD.EAD_Transfer_Parent_Container_Info
member.summary: Class stores information about the containers which hold a component object from this EAD.
member.remarks:
This is an abstraction which replaced the strict box, folder, item structure. Those types of containers are still the most commonly encountered though.
This class contains information about a single level of the container hierarchy, and is generally used within a list of different types (i.e., one for the box information, one for the folder information, etc.. )

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_RequestType_Enum
member.summary: Enumeration indicates the type of HTTP request expected for this microservice endpoint

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_RequestType_Enum.DELETE
member.summary: Endpoint is called with a HTTP DELETE call, which should remove a resource or link

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_RequestType_Enum.GET
member.summary: Endpoint is called with a standard HTTP GET, perhaps including arguments in the command line

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_RequestType_Enum.POST
member.summary: Endpoint is called with a HTTP POST call, including some object in the body of the post request and usually adds a new resource

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_RequestType_Enum.PUT
member.summary: Endpoint is called with a HTTP PUT call, including some object in the body of the post request and usually updates a new resource

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_RequestType_Enum.ERROR
member.summary: Invalid HTTP verb found

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_Protocol_Enum
member.summary: Enumeration indicates the type of protocol utilized by this endpoint

member.summary: Output of this endpoint is a binary stream

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_Protocol_Enum.CACHE
member.summary: Nothing is output ( serialized, deserialized ) but the engine places the object within the (shared) cache

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_Protocol_Enum.JSON
member.summary: Output of this endpoint is standard JSON

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_Protocol_Enum.JSON_P
member.summary: Output of this endpoint is JSON-P

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_Protocol_Enum.PROTOBUF
member.summary: Output of this endpoint is Protocol Buffer octet-stream

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_Protocol_Enum.SOAP
member.summary: Serve the object, via SOAP

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_Protocol_Enum.TEXT
member.summary: Return the information as text-only

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Engine.Microservice_Endpoint_Protocol_Enum.XML
member.summary: Output in XML format

member.summary: Static class is used to change between codes and language names to the language enumeration

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Localization.Web_Language_Enum_Converter.Code_To_Enum(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the web browser code to the web language enumeration
member.param: Code for the browser
member.returns: Enumeration for the language, as specified by the browser code
member.remarks: If this is a sub-language, or refinement code, like 'en-us', and there is no match this will call itself recursively to see if the base language ('en' for example) is recognized.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Localization.Web_Language_Enum_Converter.Name_To_Code(System.String)
member.summary: Given a language name, returns the associated browser code
member.param: Name of the language
member.returns: Code " the language

member.summary: Given the language enumeration, return the associated language name
member.param: Enumeration for the web language
member.returns: Name for the language

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Localization.Web_Language_Enum_Converter.Enum_To_Code(SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Localization.Web_Language_Enum)
member.summary: Convert enumeration to two digit ISO language code
member.param: Enumeration value to convert to the ISO code
member.returns: Two digit ISO code

member.summary: Create a new instance of the Web_Language_Translation_Lookup class

member.summary: Add a translation value for a specific language
member.param: Language for the provided value
String value for provided language

member.summary: Gets the value for a provided language
member.param: Language to attempt to find in this translation lookup object
member.returns: Either a value, or "No Value" string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Localization.Web_Language_Translation_Lookup.DefaultValue
member.summary: Default value used if the requested language is not present

member.name: P:SobekCM.Core.Configuration.Localization.Web_Language_Translation_Lookup.Count
member.summary: Return the number of values within this lookup object
member.remarks: If the default value exists and is also added under the default language, this will return the value 2. No checks are made to ensure the value in the lookup object is not the same as the default value. That is, this does not check for UNIQUE values, just values.

member.summary: Gets the list of translated values with the web language

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetFastSerializerSurrogate
member.summary: An ISurrogateSelector implementation which looks for supported ADO.Net serializable types (DataSet and DataTable) and returns itself as an ISerializationSurrogate which can serialize those objects using Fast Serialization.
member.remarks: Code written by Simon Hewitt and dedicated to public domain (2006)

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetFastSerializerSurrogate.ChainSelector(System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector)
member.summary: Stores the next surrogate selector in the chain.
member.param: The ISurrogateSelector to chain.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetFastSerializerSurrogate.GetNextSelector
member.summary: Returns the next surrogate in the chain.
member.returns: Returns the next ISurrogateSelector in the chain.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetFastSerializerSurrogate.GetSurrogate(System.Type,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext,System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector@)
member.summary: Checks the Type and, if supported, returns this as an appropriate ISerializationSurrogate object.
member.param: The Type to check.
See .Net serialization.
this if the Type is supported; null otherwise.
member.returns: An ISerializationSurrogate object (this) if Type is supported; null otherwise.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetFastSerializerSurrogate.SetObjectData(System.Object,System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext,System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the object being deserialized (since no constructors are called) then deserializes data into it.
member.param: The DataSet or DataTable to serialize.
See .Net serialization.
See .Net serialization.
The selector which selected this surrogate.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetFastSerializerSurrogate.GetObjectData(System.Object,System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Serializes the contents of the object into a byte[] and stores in the SerializationInfo block.
member.param: The object to serialize.
See .Net serialization.
See .Net serialization.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetFastSerializerSurrogate.createNewInstance(System.Object)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the supplied object because the object will be completely uninitialized as supplied to SetObjectData. If the object is a DataSet or DataTable (not derived from these) then a new instance is created directly otherwise a new instance is created by Activator.CreateInstance() so the type must have a parameterless constructor.
member.param: The uninitialized object to recreate.
member.returns: A new instance of the type of object passed in.

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper
member.summary: Contains static helper methods for ADO.Net objects including Fast Serialization
member.remarks: Code written by Simon Hewitt and dedicated to public domain (2006)

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.SerializeTypedDataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Serializes a Typed DataTable to a byte[] containing only the data (ie no infrastructure)
member.param: The Typed DataTable to serialize.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.remarks: The DataTable must be Typed and not a plain DataTable. It must also not have had any new columns added to it. In either of these cases, use SerializeDataTable instead.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.SerializeTypedDataSet(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Serializes a Typed DataSet to a byte[] containing only the data for each DataTable (ie no infrastructure)
member.param: The Typed DataSet to serialize.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.remarks: The DataSet must be Typed and not a plain DataSet. It must also not have had any new columns/tables added to it. In either of these cases, use SerializeDataSet instead.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.SerializeDataSet(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Serializes a DataSet to a byte[].
member.param: The DataSet to serialize.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.SerializeDataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Serializes a DataTable to a byte[].
member.param: The DataTable to serialize.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.SerializeSimpleTypedDataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Serializes a simple Typed DataTable to a byte[] containing only data.
member.param: The Typed DataTable to serialize.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.remarks: A simple Typed DataTable will have no Errors associated with the rows or columns and all rows should be Unchanged/Added (deserialized rows will always be Unchanged). Deleted rows will throw an exception. Designed for read-only tables which need to be serialized to a minumum size.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeTypedDataSet(System.Type,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserializes a Typed DataSet from a byte[] containing serialized data only.
member.param: The Type of Typed DataSet to deserialize.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.returns: A new DataSet of the requested type.
member.remarks: The Type must match that from which the serialized data was originally obtained and it must have a parameterless constructor.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeTypedDataSet(System.Data.DataSet,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserializes a Typed DataSet from a byte[] containing serialized data only.
member.param: The Typed DataSet to deserialize into.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.returns: The same DataSet passed in.
member.remarks: The DataSet must be of the same type from which the serialized data was originally obtained.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeTypedDataTable(System.Type,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserializes a Typed DataTable from a byte[] containing serialized data only.

A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.returns: A new DataTable of the requested type.
member.remarks: The Type must match that from which the serialized data was originally obtained and it must have a parameterless constructor.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeTypedDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserializes a Typed DataTable from a byte[] containing serialized data only.
member.param: The Typed DataTable to deserialize into.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.returns: The same DataTable passed in.
member.remarks: The DataTable must be of the same type from which the serialized data was originally obtained.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeDataSet(System.Type,System.Byte[])

member.returns: Deserialized dataset

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeSimpleTypedDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Populates an existing Typed DataTable with row data previously serialized using SerializeSimpleTypedDataTable.
member.param: The DataTable into which to deserialize row data.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter
member.summary:
A SerializationWriter instance is used to store values and objects in a byte array.
Once an instance is created, use the various methods to store the required data. ToArray() will return a byte[] containing all of the data required for deserialization. This can be stored in the SerializationInfo parameter in an ISerializable.GetObjectData() method.
As an alternative to ToArray(), if you want to apply some post-processing to the serialized bytes, such as compression, call AppendTokenTables first to ensure that the string and object token tables are appended to the stream, and then cast BaseStream to MemoryStream. You can then access the MemoryStream's internal buffer as follows:
writer.AppendTokenTables(); MemoryStream stream = (MemoryStream) writer.BaseStream; serializedData = MiniLZO.Compress(stream.GetBuffer(), (int) stream.Length);
member.remarks: Code written by Simon Hewitt and dedicated to public domain (2006)

member.summary: Allows any object implementing IOwnedDataSerializable to serialize itself into this SerializationWriter. A context may also be used to give the object an indication of what data to store. As an example, using a BitVector32 gives a list of flags and the object can conditionally store data depending on those flags.
member.param: The IOwnedDataSerializable object to ask for owned data
An arbtritrary object but BitVector32 recommended

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteObject(System.Object)
member.summary:
Stores an object into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on type and/or content.
1 byte: null, DBNull.Value, Boolean
1 to 2 bytes: Int16, UInt16, Byte, SByte, Char,
1 to 4 bytes: Int32, UInt32, Single, BitVector32
1 to 8 bytes: DateTime, TimeSpan, Double, Int64, UInt64
1 or 16 bytes: Guid
1 plus content: string, object[], byte[], char[], BitArray, Type, ArrayList
Any other object be stored using a .Net Binary formatter but this should only be allowed as a last resort: Since this is effectively a different serialization session, there is a possibility of the same shared object being serialized twice or, if the object has a reference directly or indirectly back to the parent object, there is a risk of looping which will throw an exception.
The type of object is checked with the most common types being checked first. Each 'section' can be reordered to provide optimum speed but the check for null should always be first and the default serialization always last.
Once the type is identified, a SerializedType byte is stored in the stream followed by the data for the object (certain types/values may not require storage of data as the SerializedType may imply the value).
For certain objects, if the value is within a certain range then optimized storage may be used. If the value doesn't meet the required optimization criteria then the value is stored directly. The checks for optimization may be disabled by setting the OptimizeForSize property to false in which case the value is stored directly. This could result in a slightly larger stream but there will be a speed increate to compensate.
member.param: The object to store.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Calls WriteOptimized(string). This override to hide base BinaryWriter.Write(string).
member.param: The string to store.

true to store the AssemblyQualifiedName or false to store the FullName.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32)
member.summary:
Writes a BitVector32 into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 to 4 bytes. (.Net is 4 bytes) 1 to 7 bits takes 1 byte 8 to 14 bits takes 2 bytes 15 to 21 bits takes 3 bytes 22 to 28 bits takes 4 bytes ------------------------------------------------------------------- 29 to 32 bits takes 5 bytes - use Write(BitVector32) method instead
Try to order the BitVector32 masks so that the highest bits are least-likely to be set.
member.param: The BitVector32 to store. Must not use more than 28 bits.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Writes a DateTime value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 3 bytes to 7 bytes (.Net is 8 bytes) Notes: A DateTime containing only a date takes 3 bytes (except a .NET 2.0 Date with a specified DateTimeKind which will take a minimum of 5 bytes - no further optimization for this situation felt necessary since it is unlikely that a DateTimeKind would be specified without hh:mm also) Date plus hh:mm takes 5 bytes. Date plus hh:mm:ss takes 6 bytes. Date plus hh:mm:ss.fff takes 7 bytes.
member.param: The DateTime value to store. Must not contain sub-millisecond data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Writes a Decimal value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte to 14 bytes (.Net is 16 bytes) Restrictions: None
member.param: The Decimal value to store

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Write an Int32 value using the fewest number of bytes possible.
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(Int32 value)
member.remarks:
0x00000000 - 0x0000007f (0 to 127) takes 1 byte 0x00000080 - 0x000003FF (128 to 16,383) takes 2 bytes 0x00000400 - 0x001FFFFF (16,384 to 2,097,151) takes 3 bytes 0x00200000 - 0x0FFFFFFF (2,097,152 to 268,435,455) takes 4 bytes ---------------------------------------------------------------- 0x10000000 - 0x07FFFFFF (268,435,456 and above) takes 5 bytes All negative numbers take 5 bytes
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(Int32 value)
member.param: The Int32 to store. Must be between 0 and 268,435,455 inclusive.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Int64)
member.param: The Int64 to store. Must be between 0 and 72,057,594,037,927,935 inclusive.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.String)
member.summary:
Writes a string value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on string length Notes: Encodes null, Empty, 'Y', 'N', ' ' values as a single byte Any other single char string is stored as two bytes All other strings are stored in a string token list:
The TypeCode representing the current string token list is written first (1 byte), followed by the string token itself (1-4 bytes)
When the current string list has reached 128 values then a new string list is generated and that is used for generating future string tokens. This continues until the maximum number (128) of string lists is in use, after which the string lists are used in a round-robin fashion. By doing this, more lists are created with fewer items which allows a smaller token size to be used for more strings.
The first 16,384 strings will use a 1 byte token. The next 2,097,152 strings will use a 2 byte token. (This should suffice for most uses!) The next 268,435,456 strings will use a 3 byte token. (My, that is a lot!!) The next 34,359,738,368 strings will use a 4 byte token. (only shown for completeness!!!)
member.param: The string to store.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes a TimeSpan value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 2 bytes to 8 bytes (.Net is 8 bytes) Notes: hh:mm (time) are always stored together and take 2 bytes. If seconds are present then 3 bytes unless (time) is not present in which case 2 bytes since the seconds are stored in the minutes position. If milliseconds are present then 4 bytes. In addition, if days are present they will add 1 to 4 bytes to the above.
member.param: The TimeSpan value to store. Must not contain sub-millisecond data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Type)
member.summary: Stores a non-null Type object into the stream. Stored Size: Depends on the length of the Type's name. If the type is a System type (mscorlib) then it is stored without assembly name information, otherwise the Type's AssemblyQualifiedName is used.
member.param: The Type to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Write a UInt32 value using the fewest number of bytes possible. 0x00000000 - 0x0000007f (0 to 127) takes 1 byte 0x00000080 - 0x000003FF (128 to 16,383) takes 2 bytes 0x00000400 - 0x001FFFFF (16,384 to 2,097,151) takes 3 bytes 0x00200000 - 0x0FFFFFFF (2,097,152 to 268,435,455) takes 4 bytes ---------------------------------------------------------------- 0x10000000 - 0xFFFFFFFF (268,435,456 and above) takes 5 bytes
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(UInt32 value)
member.param: The UInt32 to store. Must be between 0 and 268,435,455 inclusive.

member.param: The UInt64 to store. Must be between 0 and 72,057,594,037,927,935 inclusive.

member.summary: Writes a pair of object[] arrays into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. The arrays must not be null and must have the same length The first array's values are written optimized The second array's values are compared against the first and, where identical, will be stored using a single byte. Useful for storing entity data where there is a before-change and after-change set of value pairs and, typically, only a few of the values will have changed.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.AppendTokenTables
member.summary: Writes the contents of the string and object token tables into the stream. Also write the starting offset into the first 4 bytes of the stream. Notes: Called automatically by ToArray(). Can be used to ensure that the complete graph is written before using an alternate technique of extracting a Byte[] such as using compression on the underlying stream.
member.returns: The length of the string and object tables.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.ToArray
member.summary:
Returns a byte[] containing all of the serialized data.
The current implementation has the data in 3 sections: 1) A 4 byte Int32 giving the offset to the 3rd section. 2) The main serialized data. 3) The serialized string tokenization lists and object tokenization lists.
Only call this method once all of the data has been serialized.
This method appends all of the tokenized data (string and object) to the end of the stream and ensures that the first four bytes reflect the offset of the tokenized data so that it can be deserialized first. This is the reason for requiring a rewindable stream.
Future implementations may also allow the serialized data to be accessed via 2 byte[] arrays. This would remove the requirement for a rewindable stream opening the possibility of streaming the serialized data directly over the network allowing simultaneous of partially simultaneous deserialization.
member.returns: A byte[] containing all serialized data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteBytesDirect(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes a byte[] directly into the stream. The size of the array is not stored so only use this method when the number of bytes will be known at deserialization time.
A null value will throw an exception
member.param: The byte[] to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteStringDirect(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a non-null string directly to the stream without tokenization.
member.param: The string to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteTokenizedObject(System.Object)
member.summary:
Writes a token (an Int32 taking 1 to 4 bytes) into the stream that represents the object instance. The same token will always be used for the same object instance.
The object will be serialized once and recreated at deserialization time. Calls to SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject() will retrieve the same object instance.
member.param: The object to tokenize. Must not be null and must not be a string.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteTokenizedObject(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Writes a token (an Int32 taking 1 to 4 bytes) into the stream that represents the object instance. The same token will always be used for the same object instance.
When recreateFromType is set to true, the object's Type will be stored and the object recreated using Activator.GetInstance with a parameterless contructor. This is useful for stateless, factory-type classes.
When recreateFromType is set to false, the object will be serialized once and recreated at deserialization time.
Calls to SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject() will retrieve the same object instance.
member.param: The object to tokenize. Must not be null and must not be a string.
true if the object can be recreated using a parameterless constructor; false if the object should be serialized as-is

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.encodeTimeSpan(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes a TimeSpan into the fewest number of bytes. Has been separated from the WriteOptimized(TimeSpan) method so that WriteOptimized(DateTime) can also use this for .NET 2.0 DateTimeKind information. By taking advantage of the fact that a DateTime's TimeOfDay portion will never use the IsNegative and HasDays flags, we can use these 2 bits to store the DateTimeKind and, since DateTimeKind is unlikely to be set without a Time, we need no additional bytes to support a .NET 2.0 DateTime.
member.param: The TimeSpan to store.
True if the TimeSpan is the TimeOfDay from a DateTime; False if a real TimeSpan.
The intial data for the BitVector32 - contains DateTimeKind or 0

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.checkOptimizable(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether an optimization condition has been met and throw an exception if not.
This method has been made conditional on THROW_IF_NOT_OPTIMIZABLE being set at compile time. By default, this is set if DEBUG is set but could be set explicitly if exceptions are required and the evaluation overhead is acceptable. If not set, then this method and all references to it are removed at compile time.
Leave at the default for optimum usage.
member.param: An expression evaluating to true if the optimization condition is met, false otherwise.
The message to include in the exception should the optimization condition not be met.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedSigned32BitValue(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Stores a 32-bit signed value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(Int32) for details of the values that are optimizable.
member.param: The Int32 value to encode.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedSigned64BitValue(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Stores a 64-bit signed value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(Int64) for details of the values that are optimizable.
member.param: The Int64 value to encode.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedUnsigned32BitValue(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Stores a 32-bit unsigned value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(UInt32) for details of the values that are optimizable.
member.param: The UInt32 value to encode.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedUnsigned64BitValue(System.UInt64)
member.summary:
Stores a 64-bit unsigned value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(ULong) for details of the values that are optimizable.
member.param: The ULong value to encode.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.writeObjectArray(System.Object[])
member.summary:
Writes the values in the non-null object[] into the stream.
Sequences of null values and sequences of DBNull.Values are stored with a flag and optimized count. Other values are stored using WriteObject().
This routine is called by the Write(object[]), WriteOptimized(object[]) and Write(object[], object[])) methods.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.writeTypeCode(SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializedType)
member.summary:
Stores the specified SerializedType code into the stream.
By using a centralized method, it is possible to collect statistics for the type of data being stored in DEBUG mode.
Use the DumpTypeUsage() method to show a list of used SerializedTypes and the number of times each has been used. This method and the collection code will be optimized out when compiling in Release mode.
member.param: The SerializedType to store.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.writeTypedArray(System.Array,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal implementation to write a non-null typed array into the stream.
member.remarks:
Checks first to see if the element type is a primitive type and calls the correct routine if so. Otherwise determines the best, optimized method to store the array contents.
An array of object elements never stores its type.
member.param: The non-null typed array to store.
True if the type should be stored; false otherwise

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.isTypeRecreatable(System.Type)
member.summary: Checks whether instances of a Type can be created.
member.remarks: A Value Type only needs to implement IOwnedDataSerializable. A Reference Type needs to implement IOwnedDataSerializableAndRecreatable and provide a default constructor.
member.param: The Type to check
member.returns: true if the Type is recreatable; false otherwise.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.arrayElementsAreSameType(System.Object[],System.Type)
member.summary: Checks whether each element in an array is of the same type.
member.param: The array to check
The expected element type.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.writeTypedArrayTypeCode(System.Collections.BitArray,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the TypeCode for the Typed Array followed by the number of elements.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.DumpTypeUsage
member.summary: Dump the type usage information while debugging

member.name: P:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.OptimizeForSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets a boolean flag to indicate whether to optimize for size (default) by storing data as packed bits or sections where possible. Setting this value to false will turn off this optimization and store data directly which increases the speed. Note: This only affects optimization of data passed to the WriteObject method and direct calls to the WriteOptimized methods will always pack data into the smallest space where possible.

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.UniqueStringList
member.summary:
Provides a faster way to store string tokens both maintaining the order that they were added and providing a fast lookup.
Based on code developed by ewbi at http://ewbi.blogs.com/develops/2006/10/uniquestringlis.html

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationReader
member.summary:
A SerializationReader instance is used to read stored values and objects from a byte array.
Once an instance is created, use the various methods to read the required data. The data read MUST be exactly the same type and in the same order as it was written.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.MemoryMgmt.SerializationReader.decodeTimeSpan(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Returns a TimeSpan decoded from packed data. This routine is called from ReadOptimizedDateTime() and ReadOptimizedTimeSpan().
This routine uses a parameter to allow ReadOptimizedDateTime() to 'peek' at the next byte and extract the DateTimeKind from bits one and two (IsNegative and HasDays) which are never set for a Time portion of a DateTime.
member.param: The first of two always-present bytes.
member.returns: A decoded TimeSpan

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum
member.summary: Writer type which determines what type of response is requested
member.remarks:
This generally corresponds to which type of Main Writer is used, and which ASP application replies
This value generally comes from the first character of the mode value in the URL query string ( m=X... )

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.HTML
member.summary: Response should be in HTML

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.HTML_Echo
member.summary: Simple writer just echoes through an existing HTML page through this application with very little logic (used for robot search engines mostly)

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.HTML_LoggedIn
member.summary: Response should be in HTML, but the user is logged in
member.remarks: This seperate writer type is implemented to force the user's system to refresh when the user's logon state changes.

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.DataSet
member.summary: Response should be in microsoft compliant dataset format
member.remarks:
This type of request is forwarded to sobekcm_data.aspx
Generally, this is achieved by just using the standard write to xml routines in a DataSet

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.Data_Provider
member.summary: Response should be a portion of a datatable, in JSON response
member.remarks: This is used to provide data server-side for the jQuery Datatable plug-in mostly

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.JSON
member.summary: Response should be in simplified JSON (Javan Simple Object Notation) format
member.remarks:
This type of request is forwarded to sobekcm_data.aspx
This is used to provide support to the iPhone application

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.OAI
member.summary: Response should be compliant with the OAI-PMH standard
member.remarks: This type of request is forwarded to sobekcm_oai.aspx

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.Text
member.summary: Response should be in HTML, but be simple text, not formatted

member.name: F:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.XML
member.summary: Response should be in simplified XML format
member.remarks: This type of request is forwarded to sobekcm_data.aspx

member.summary: Algorithm tests the user agent and IP address against known robots to determine if this request is from a search engine indexer or web site crawler bot.

IP address from the HTTP request
member.returns: TRUE if the request appears to be a robot, otherwise FALSE

member.name: M:SobekCM.Core.Navigation.Navigation_Object.Set_Robot_Flag(System.String,System.String)

member.param: User Agent string from the HTTP request
IP address from the HTTP request
member.returns: TRUE if the request appears to be a robot, otherwise FALSE

member.name: T:SobekCM.Core.Skins.Web_Skin_Object
member.summary: Stores information about an HTML skin, which determines the header, footer, stylesheet, and other design elements for the rendered HTML
member.remarks:
This class and concept allows the same pages in this digital library to appear branded in different ways. It allows the rendered html to be altered to match a partner's institutional web pages as well.
Since this class holds the header, footer, and banner information, this HTML skin object is language-specific.
